events.title: Duchess of York called Epstein 'supreme friend' in 2011 email
events.snippet: A spokesperson for the duchess says the message was sent to counter a threat Epstein had made to sue her for defamation.

events.title: Heathrow braces for second day of disruption after cyber-attack
events.snippet: The issue affecting check-in and baggage systems caused hundreds of delays and cancellations on Saturday.

events.title: Veteran broadcaster John Stapleton dies aged 79
events.snippet: The presenter, who featured on the BBC's Watchdog, had been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.

events.snippet: As its popularity grows, research suggests creatine may also benefit short-term memory, mood and focus.

events.snippet: What would you do if you were stuck on a ship, far from loved ones, and you had no idea how - or when - you’d get home?

events.title: My student loan doesn't cover my bills, so I wear my work uniform to lectures

events.title: Hamnet to Sinners: 12 films to look out for as Oscars race begins
events.snippet: The top contenders for Hollywood’s awards season have emerged following the autumn film festivals.

events.title: Dating apps, booze and clubbing - Jane Austen's Emma comes into the 21st Century
events.snippet: A new play based on Austen's classic novel places the book's central character in modern-day Essex.

events.snippet: Friends of the stabbed 21-year-old Kenyan woman recount to the BBC events on the night she went missing.

events.snippet: The Lib Dem leader urges Ofcom to launch an investigation into the tech mogul and his social platform.

events.snippet: Justice Secretary David Lammy is trying to improve jail safety after several high-profile attacks.

events.snippet: Liverpool's Women's Super League match at Aston Villa on Sunday is postponed following the death of former manager Matt Beard.

events.snippet: Tensions have risen across Europe after 19 drones entered Polish territory earlier this month.

events.snippet: Saturday's spectacular saw a performance by last year's winners Chris McCausland and Dianne Buswell, along with pop star Jessie J.

events.snippet: The first flight is scheduled for September 25, 2025, and the second for September 28. After that, there will be direct flights to Guangzhou every Sunday, Tuesday and Saturday

events.snippet: Asked when seat sharing talks are expected to conclude, CPI(M) General Secretary M.A. Baby said RJD leaders will have to take the initiative
sources: News: Today’s News update from The Hindu | The Hindu

events.title: $100k H-1B fees higher than salaries of many professionals: L-1 visas an alternative?
events.snippet: The Trump administration's $100,000 H-1B visa fee hike is poised to significantly impact the Indian IT sector. Companies may explore L-1 visas, but these face limitations and increased scrutiny. Experts warn of workforce departures, offshore job movement, and a potential boost for countries like India.

events.title: No cake this time: Hindu Sena that once did havan for Trump now says he's lost 'good sense'
events.snippet: Vishnu Gupta, who once called Trump a "hero", now thinks the US president has "lost his good sense".

events.title: IND vs PAK drama! Pakistan cancel press conference; Mohsin Naqvi's three-word reply sparks buzz
events.snippet: Amidst handshake controversy and tensions with the ICC match referee, PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi visited Pakistan's training session before their Asia Cup Super Fours clash against India. Naqvi engaged in an intense discussion with coach Mike Hesson, following the cancellation of Pakistan's pre-match press conference. The visit occurs after Pakistan sought the removal of Andy Pycroft over a handshake dispute.

events.title: Rift widens in Lalu family as Rohini unfollows RJD, kin
events.snippet: The internal conflict within Lalu Prasad's family has intensified with Rohini Acharya unfollowing key family members and the RJD on social media due to disagreements over Tejashwi Yadav's associate, Sanjay Yadav. Tej Pratap Yadav has defended Rohini, escalating the family feud

events.title: H-1B visa hike: Zoho founder to Indians in US; ‘Do not live in fear’
events.snippet: Following the significant H-1B visa fee increase announced by the US, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is encouraging Indian tech professionals in America to return to India. Drawing parallels with the Partition, Vembu assures them that rebuilding their lives in India will ultimately lead to success, given the country's burgeoning opportunities and thriving tech ecosystem.

events.title: ‘Zero civic sense’: Tourists 'vandalise' Humayun’s Tomb in Delhi
events.snippet: A video showing visitors allegedly vandalising Humayun's Tomb, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, has sparked outrage online. The footage shows a young man scribbling on a wall while others film. While some shots appear to be from other locations, ASI officials confirmed parts of the video were from the tomb.

events.title: H-1B visa rules: US clarifies Trump’s requirement; applies only to new applicants
events.snippet: USCIS clarified that Trump's new order imposing a $100,000 fee on H-1B visas applies only to new petitions filed after September 21, 2025. This is a one-time fee, not an annual charge, and does not affect existing H-1B visa holders or those with petitions filed before the specified date. The proclamation aims to address systemic abuse of H-1B visas.

events.title: 'Our cricket is in a pathetic state'- Former Pak player drops bombshell ahead of India clash
events.snippet: Following Pakistan's dismal performance against India in the Asia Cup, Danish Kaneria has strongly criticized the national team and its management. He highlighted the lack of accountability and strategic planning within Pakistan cricket. The controversy surrounding the handshake snub and calls for structural changes underscore the urgent need for improvement as they face India again in the Super 4s.

events.title: From Covid to Op Sindoor: PM Modi's speeches over the years; all eyes on 5pm address
events.snippet: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to address the nation at 5 pm on Sunday, as confirmed by the PMO. While the topic remains undisclosed, speculations suggest a focus on economic changes, coinciding with Navratri's start and upcoming GST reforms. Over his more than ten years in office, PM Modi has often addressed the nation to announce major decisions.

events.title: 'Will he address concerns or same talk again': Congress on PM Modi speech
events.snippet: Jairam Ramesh criticizes PM Modi, alleging that Donald Trump, Modi's "good friend," repeatedly claimed credit for halting Operation Sindoor by leveraging trade with America. Ramesh questions whether Modi will address deteriorating India-US relations, H1B holder concerns, or tariff-related livelihood risks during his address to the nation.

events.title: H-1B visa hike: JPMorgan asks staff to return to US before Sept 21
events.snippet: JPMorgan and Microsoft are urging H-1B visa holders to return to the U.S. immediately due to President Trump's new directive imposing a $100,000 annual fee on companies for each H-1B worker. This move, effective September 21st, is anticipated to disproportionately impact Indian IT firms like Infosys and TCS, who heavily rely on H-1B visas to deploy professionals in the U.S.

events.title: No mercy! Suryavanshi targets Australia bowlers - Watch
events.snippet: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old phenomenon, ignited India's chase of 225 against Australia U19 with a rapid 38 off 22 balls, including seven fours and a six. His aggressive start put the Australian bowlers under pressure early on. Despite a shaky start for the middle order after his dismissal, Suryavanshi's power-hitting became the highlight of India's innings.

events.title: Zubeen Garg’s final journey: Thousands bid farewell to Assam’s music icon
events.snippet: Assam mourns the loss of Zubeen Garg, its beloved singer, whose remains arrived in Guwahati on Sunday. Tens of thousands of fans lined the streets, paying their respects to the artist, who died in Singapore following a swimming accident. The outpouring of grief saw shops closed and citizens gathering to honor Garg, a cultural icon who recorded over 38,000 songs.

events.title: Bengaluru residents protest, demand pothole-free roads
events.snippet: Residents of Varthur and Gunjur are protesting for better roads. A recent death due to traffic has sparked outrage. People are demanding pothole-free and dust-free roads. The Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited road widening project is delayed. Alternative routes are also in poor condition. Residents are frustrated with daily struggles and demand immediate action. Police intervened in protests outside residences.

events.title: 4-year-old kidnapped, thrown off cliff by teen neighbor seeking revenge on boy’s mother
events.snippet: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Anand Parbat, a four-year-old boy is critically injured after being kidnapped and attacked by a 15-year-old neighbor. The teenager, seeking revenge against the boy's mother for a previous disciplinary action, lured the child to a secluded area, threw him off a cliff, and bludgeoned him with a rock.

events.title: Blindfolded cow pushed into drain; rescued by villagers in Haryana
events.snippet: In a disturbing incident near Jamal village, Sirsa, villagers discovered a cow blindfolded and struggling in a drain. Residents rescued the animal, which had been deliberately thrown into the water overnight. The cow is now under the care of the Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati Gaushala Committee, while villagers condemn the inhumane act and demand strict action against those responsible.

events.title: IND vs PAK showdown: Declaration - 'India will beat Pakistan in Super Four'
events.snippet: Monty Panesar believes the India-Pakistan handshake controversy has dampened enthusiasm for their Asia Cup Super 4 match. He urges both teams to prioritize cricket amid political tensions. Panesar predicts India will win the upcoming game. The reduced excitement reflects strained relations between the two nations. India previously defeated Pakistan by seven wickets.

events.title: Triple whammy for India after tariffs and Chabahar
'Shahid Afridi dog meat khaata hai': Irfan Pathan’s brutal attack on Afridi
events.snippet: Irfan Pathan revealed a heated exchange with Shahid Afridi during a 2006 flight from Karachi to Lahore, where Afridi's condescending behavior sparked a verbal altercation. Pathan recounted how he cleverly silenced Afridi by humorously suggesting he had consumed dog meat after Afridi used abusive language.

events.title: Birthday bash turns tragic in Gujarat: 25-year-old stabbed to death by robber
events.snippet: In a tragic turn, Vaibhav Manwani's 25th birthday celebration ended in his fatal stabbing near Ahmedabad's Narmada canal. A robber attacked Manwani and his 23-year-old friend, who bravely ran 800 meters for help despite her own stab wounds. She is now stable in Civil Hospital.
